definitions.definition: a building or part of a hospital where people can go for special medical treatment or advice

examples.text: He was treated at the hospital's eye clinic.
The patient then returns to the outpatient clinic two weeks later.
She is being treated at a diabetic clinic.
I work in a a family planning clinic.
The crash victims were all treated in a local clinic.

definitions.definition: a period of time during which doctors give special medical treatment or advice

examples.text: The antenatal clinic is on Wednesdays.
Doctors held a special clinic to talk to worried parents after a child at the school died of meningitis.
The surgery holds a baby clinic every Wednesday afternoon.
We operate free rural health clinics.
a clinic for people with asthma

definitions.definition: a private hospital or one that treats health problems of a particular kind

examples.text: He is being treated at the London clinic.
a rehabilitation clinic for people with alcoholism
She was ordered to attend a drug rehabilitation clinic.
He is being treated at a clinic in Harley Street.

definitions.definition: a building shared by a group of doctors who work together
an occasion in a hospital when medical students learn by watching a specialist examine and treat patients
an occasion at which a professional person, especially a sportsman or sportswoman gives advice and training

examples.text: a coaching clinic for young tennis players
The boxing clinic aims to provide talented boxers with help to further their careers.

wordOrigin: mid 19th cent. (in the sense ‘teaching of medicine at the bedside’): from French clinique, from Greek klinikē (tekhnē) ‘bedside (art)’, from klinē ‘bed’.
